briefdescription.para: Compile time constant representing what kind of schema this class is.
Construct a UsdPhysicsDriveAPI on UsdPrim prim with name name .

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to UsdPhysicsDriveAPI::Get( prim.GetStage(), prim.GetPath().AppendProperty( "drive:name"));
for a valid prim, but will not immediately throw an error for an invalid prim

briefdescription.para: Construct a UsdPhysicsDriveAPI on the prim held by schemaObj with name name.

detaileddescription.para: Should be preferred over UsdPhysicsDriveAPI(schemaObj.GetPrim(), name), as it preserves SchemaBase state.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Returns the name of this multiple-apply schema instance.
Drive spring is for the acceleration at the joint (rather than the force).
See GetTypeAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Maximum force that can be applied to drive.

detaileddescription.para: Units: if linear drive: mass*DIST_UNITS/second/second if angular drive: mass*DIST_UNITS*DIST_UNITS/second/second inf means not limited. Must be non-negative.

briefdescription.para: See GetMaxForceAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Target value for position.

detaileddescription.para: Units: if linear drive: distance if angular drive: degrees.

briefdescription.para: See GetTargetPositionAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Target value for velocity.

detaileddescription.para: Units: if linear drive: distance/second if angular drive: degrees/second.

briefdescription.para: See GetTargetVelocityAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Damping of the drive.

detaileddescription.para: Units: if linear drive: mass/second If angular drive: mass*DIST_UNITS*DIST_UNITS/second/degrees.

briefdescription.para: See GetDampingAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Stiffness of the drive.

detaileddescription.para: Units: if linear drive: mass/second/second if angular drive: mass*DIST_UNITS*DIST_UNITS/degrees/second/second.

briefdescription.para: See GetStiffnessAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Return a vector of names of all pre-declared attributes for this schema class and all its ancestor classes.

detaileddescription.para: Does not include attributes that may be authored by custom/extended methods of the schemas involved.

briefdescription.para: Return a vector of names of all pre-declared attributes for this schema class and all its ancestor classes for a given instance name.

detaileddescription.para: Does not include attributes that may be authored by custom/extended methods of the schemas involved. The names returned will have the proper namespace prefix.

briefdescription.para: Return a UsdPhysicsDriveAPI holding the prim adhering to this schema at path on stage.

detaileddescription.para: If no prim exists at path on stage, or if the prim at that path does not adhere to this schema, return an invalid schema object. path must be of the format <path>.drive:name .
This is shorthand for the following:

briefdescription.para: Return a UsdPhysicsDriveAPI with name name holding the prim prim.

detaileddescription.para: Shorthand for UsdPhysicsDriveAPI(prim, name);

briefdescription.para: Return a vector of all named instances of UsdPhysicsDriveAPI on the given prim.
Checks if the given name baseName is the base name of a property of PhysicsDriveAPI.
Checks if the given path path is of an API schema of type PhysicsDriveAPI.

detaileddescription.para: If so, it stores the instance name of the schema in name and returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this multiple-apply API schema can be applied, with the given instance name, name, to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: If this schema can not be a applied the prim, this returns false and, if provided, populates whyNot with the reason it can not be applied.

Note that if CanApply returns false, that does not necessarily imply that calling Apply will fail. Callers are expected to call CanApply before calling Apply if they want to ensure that it is valid to apply a schema.

briefdescription.para: Applies this multiple-apply API schema to the given prim along with the given instance name, name.

detaileddescription.para: This information is stored by adding "PhysicsDriveAPI:name" to the token-valued, listOp metadata apiSchemas on the prim. For example, if name is 'instance1', the token 'PhysicsDriveAPI:instance1' is added to 'apiSchemas'.

simplesect.para: A valid UsdPhysicsDriveAPI object is returned upon success. An invalid (or empty) UsdPhysicsDriveAPI object is returned upon failure. See UsdPrim::ApplyAPI() for conditions resulting in failure.

briefdescription.para: Returns the kind of schema this class belongs to.
The PhysicsDriveAPI when applied to any joint primitive will drive the joint towards a given target.

detaileddescription.para:
The PhysicsDriveAPI is a multipleApply schema: drive can be set per axis "transX", "transY", "transZ", "rotX", "rotY", "rotZ" or its "linear" for prismatic joint or "angular" for revolute joints. Setting these as a multipleApply schema TfToken name will define the degree of freedom the DriveAPI is applied to. Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: Force or acceleration = stiffness * (targetPosition - position)
damping * (targetVelocity - velocity)

For any described attribute Fallback Value or Allowed Values below that are text/tokens, the actual token is published and defined in UsdPhysicsTokens. So to set an attribute to the value "rightHanded", use UsdPhysicsTokens->rightHanded as the value.
